alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 1:35PM PDT until May 10 at 8:12AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Salmon Falls Creek Near Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto affecting Elko County. For the Salmon Falls Creek...including Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY, MAY 10... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Salmon Falls Creek Near Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto. * WHEN...Until Wednesday, May 10. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Overflow from Salmon Falls Creek will completely inundate the rest area along U.S. 93, about 3 miles south of Jackpot, NV. Water may begin encroaching upon the shoulder of U.S. 93 near the rest area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM PDT Tuesday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 9.5 feet by Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.8 feet on 05/18/1975. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday by 130 PM PDT.
